intro: Selago tephrodes, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Selago tephrodes is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
